alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Comanche; Cotton; Grady; Stephens (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 4:17PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Comanche, southern Grady, southeastern Caddo, northwestern Stephens and northwestern Cotton Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 416 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles west of Agawam to 5 miles southwest of Sterling to 4 miles south of Indiahoma. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lawton, Marlow, Cache, Elgin, Apache, Geronimo, Rush Springs, Fletcher, Cyril, Sterling, Alex, Cement, Medicine Park, Indiahoma, Norge, Faxon, Meers, Lake Lawtonka, Agawam and Fort Sill. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 25 and 77. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
